summary: The text discusses the Rapti Health Science Institute Act, 2074, which aims to establish and regulate the Rapti Health Science Institute for advanced research and quality healthcare services in Nepal. The Act outlines the structure, functions, and responsibilities of the institute, emphasizing the provision of high-quality healthcare services to the general public. It also establishes various committees and positions within the institute to ensure effective management and operation.

summary: The text discusses the Rapti-Dun Development Area Land Sale Distribution Act, 2024, and various legal amendments related to Nepal laws. It includes provisions for regional development plans, land distribution, and strengthening democracy. The laws aim to ensure fair land distribution, economic welfare, and gender equality. The legal amendments have been in effect since 2065 BS, with a focus on development and improving existing laws for the benefit of the general public.

summary: The text discusses the provisions of the National Debt Act, 2081, which regulates the borrowing rights of the Nepali government. It outlines the process for implementing financial proposals related to the national debt and authorizes the government to borrow within specified limits. The Act also stipulates the repayment period and interest rates for the borrowed funds, in accordance with the Public Debt Management Act, 2079.

summary: The text discusses the National Debt Regulations of Nepal, with amendments made in 2061, 2067, and 2070. The regulations outline the procedures for managing national debt, including the issuance of bonds and interest payments. It also defines the roles and responsibilities of government offices and institutions in handling debt-related matters. The regulations categorize different types of loans and specify the interest rates for each category. Amendments have been made to further clarify and expand on the existing regulations.
